Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please could you provide me with any documentation relating to how EHCPs are processed in your area, I assume that these details may be contained in a written document such as a standard operating procedure which I am happy to review even if it is felt the document is too jargonistic/internal.
If no such document exists then I would like to know:
1.How many panels are involved in the decision making process once an EHC needs assessment(EHCNA) request is received.
2. What the process is for services if a parent makes a request under regulation 6.1(h)
3. How many weeks into the process do you make a decision whether to do an assessment or not.
4. How many weeks into the process do you make a decision whether to do an issue a Plan or not.
5. How many weeks into the process do you send the draft to families?
6. How many weeks into the process do you inform families about any processes regarding school requests.
Could you also tell me for financial year 2022/23 how much was spent on appeals, how many appeals were brought and how many times the LA successfully defended an appeal at a hearing.
Yours faithfully,
Hayley

Dear Hayley Hemming,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Standard Operating
Procedures: EHCPs which we received on 16/04/2023 and you verified on
25/04/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1.How many panels are involved in the decision making process once an EHC
needs assessment(EHCNA) request is received.
• There is only one panel where both request to assess and decision to
plan cases are discussed. Therefore there are two decision making
points for each case in line with the SEND Code of Practice.
2. What the process is for services if a parent makes a request under
regulation 6.1(h).
• For such requests the Local Authority would decide whether the request
was reasonable. If it was then a notification letter would be sent. If
the request was not considered reasonable the parents would be
informed of this.
3. How many weeks into the process do you make a decision whether to do an
assessment or not.
• When a request is received it is heard at panel the following week.
The case can return to panel until all appropriate information is
received. A decision is always made by the 6 week date in line with
the SEND Code of Practice.
4. How many weeks into the process do you make a decision whether to do an
issue a Plan or not.
• The Local Authority aims to make a decision by week 12.
5. How many weeks into the process do you send the draft to families?
• The draft is sent to the family between weeks 12 and 16.
6. How many weeks into the process do you inform families about any
processes regarding school requests.
• This information is shared with the family at the same time as the
decision to issue a plan.
Could you also tell me for financial year 2022/23 how much was spent on
appeals, how many appeals were brought and how many times the LA
successfully defended an appeal at a hearing.
• Number of appeals – 118, 2 parental appeals have been rejected.
Amount spent 2022/23 - £169,410.90
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under

requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains

licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

for further details.
